speaker: CAPULET
text_entry: SCENE V. Capulet's orchard.

speaker: CAPULET
text_entry: Enter ROMEO and JULIET above, at the window

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: Wilt thou be gone? it is not yet near day:

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: It was the nightingale, and not the lark,

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: That pierced the fearful hollow of thine ear;

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: Nightly she sings on yon pomegranate-tree:

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: Believe me, love, it was the nightingale.

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: It was the lark, the herald of the morn,

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: No nightingale: look, love, what envious streaks

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: Do lace the severing clouds in yonder east:

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: Night's candles are burnt out, and jocund day

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: Stands tiptoe on the misty mountain tops.

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: I must be gone and live, or stay and die.

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: Yon light is not day-light, I know it, I:

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: It is some meteor that the sun exhales,

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: To be to thee this night a torch-bearer,

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: And light thee on thy way to Mantua:

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: Therefore stay yet; thou need'st not to be gone.

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: Let me be ta'en, let me be put to death;

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: I am content, so thou wilt have it so.

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: I'll say yon grey is not the morning's eye,

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: 'Tis but the pale reflex of Cynthia's brow;

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: Nor that is not the lark, whose notes do beat

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: The vaulty heaven so high above our heads:

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: I have more care to stay than will to go:

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: Come, death, and welcome! Juliet wills it so.

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: How is't, my soul? let's talk; it is not day.

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: It is, it is: hie hence, be gone, away!

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: It is the lark that sings so out of tune,

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: Straining harsh discords and unpleasing sharps.

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: Some say the lark makes sweet division;

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: This doth not so, for she divideth us:

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: Some say the lark and loathed toad change eyes,

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: O, now I would they had changed voices too!

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: Since arm from arm that voice doth us affray,

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: Hunting thee hence with hunt's-up to the day,

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: O, now be gone; more light and light it grows.

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: More light and light; more dark and dark our woes!

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: Enter Nurse, to the chamber

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: Madam!

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: Nurse?

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: Your lady mother is coming to your chamber:

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: The day is broke; be wary, look about.

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: Exit

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: Then, window, let day in, and let life out.

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: Farewell, farewell! one kiss, and I'll descend.

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: He goeth down

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: Art thou gone so? love, lord, ay, husband, friend!

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: I must hear from thee every day in the hour,

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: For in a minute there are many days:

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: O, by this count I shall be much in years

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: Ere I again behold my Romeo!

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: Farewell!

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: I will omit no opportunity

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: That may convey my greetings, love, to thee.

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: O think'st thou we shall ever meet again?

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: I doubt it not; and all these woes shall serve

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: For sweet discourses in our time to come.

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: O God, I have an ill-divining soul!

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: Methinks I see thee, now thou art below,

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: As one dead in the bottom of a tomb:

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: Either my eyesight fails, or thou look'st pale.

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: And trust me, love, in my eye so do you:

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: Dry sorrow drinks our blood. Adieu, adieu!

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: Exit

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: O fortune, fortune! all men call thee fickle:

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: If thou art fickle, what dost thou with him.

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: That is renown'd for faith? Be fickle, fortune;

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: For then, I hope, thou wilt not keep him long,

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: But send him back.

speaker: LADY CAPULET
text_entry: [Within]         Ho, daughter! are you up?

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: Who is't that calls? is it my lady mother?

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: Is she not down so late, or up so early?

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: What unaccustom'd cause procures her hither?

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: Enter LADY CAPULET

speaker: LADY CAPULET
text_entry: Why, how now, Juliet!

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: Madam, I am not well.

speaker: LADY CAPULET
text_entry: Evermore weeping for your cousin's death?

speaker: LADY CAPULET
text_entry: What, wilt thou wash him from his grave with tears?

speaker: LADY CAPULET
text_entry: An if thou couldst, thou couldst not make him live;

speaker: LADY CAPULET
text_entry: Therefore, have done: some grief shows much of love;

speaker: LADY CAPULET
text_entry: But much of grief shows still some want of wit.

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: Yet let me weep for such a feeling loss.

speaker: LADY CAPULET
text_entry: So shall you feel the loss, but not the friend

speaker: LADY CAPULET
text_entry: Which you weep for.

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: Feeling so the loss,

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: Cannot choose but ever weep the friend.

speaker: LADY CAPULET
text_entry: Well, girl, thou weep'st not so much for his death,

speaker: LADY CAPULET
text_entry: As that the villain lives which slaughter'd him.

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: What villain madam?

speaker: LADY CAPULET
text_entry: That same villain, Romeo.

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: [Aside]  Villain and he be many miles asunder.--

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: God Pardon him! I do, with all my heart;

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: And yet no man like he doth grieve my heart.

speaker: LADY CAPULET
text_entry: That is, because the traitor murderer lives.

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: Ay, madam, from the reach of these my hands:

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: Would none but I might venge my cousin's death!

speaker: LADY CAPULET
text_entry: We will have vengeance for it, fear thou not:

speaker: LADY CAPULET
text_entry: Then weep no more. I'll send to one in Mantua,

speaker: LADY CAPULET
text_entry: Where that same banish'd runagate doth live,

speaker: LADY CAPULET
text_entry: Shall give him such an unaccustom'd dram,

speaker: LADY CAPULET
text_entry: That he shall soon keep Tybalt company:

speaker: LADY CAPULET
text_entry: And then, I hope, thou wilt be satisfied.

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: Indeed, I never shall be satisfied

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: With Romeo, till I behold him--dead--

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: Is my poor heart for a kinsman vex'd.

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: Madam, if you could find out but a man

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: To bear a poison, I would temper it;

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: That Romeo should, upon receipt thereof,

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: Soon sleep in quiet. O, how my heart abhors

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: To hear him named, and cannot come to him.

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: To wreak the love I bore my cousin

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: Upon his body that slaughter'd him!

speaker: LADY CAPULET
text_entry: Find thou the means, and I'll find such a man.

speaker: LADY CAPULET
text_entry: But now I'll tell thee joyful tidings, girl.

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: And joy comes well in such a needy time:

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: What are they, I beseech your ladyship?

speaker: LADY CAPULET
text_entry: Well, well, thou hast a careful father, child;

speaker: LADY CAPULET
text_entry: One who, to put thee from thy heaviness,

speaker: LADY CAPULET
text_entry: Hath sorted out a sudden day of joy,

speaker: LADY CAPULET
text_entry: That thou expect'st not nor I look'd not for.

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: Madam, in happy time, what day is that?

speaker: LADY CAPULET
text_entry: Marry, my child, early next Thursday morn,

speaker: LADY CAPULET
text_entry: The gallant, young and noble gentleman,

speaker: LADY CAPULET
text_entry: The County Paris, at Saint Peter's Church,

speaker: LADY CAPULET
text_entry: Shall happily make thee there a joyful bride.

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: Now, by Saint Peter's Church and Peter too,

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: He shall not make me there a joyful bride.

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: I wonder at this haste; that I must wed

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: Ere he, that should be husband, comes to woo.

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: I pray you, tell my lord and father, madam,

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: I will not marry yet; and, when I do, I swear,

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: It shall be Romeo, whom you know I hate,

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: Rather than Paris. These are news indeed!

speaker: LADY CAPULET
text_entry: Here comes your father; tell him so yourself,

speaker: LADY CAPULET
text_entry: And see how he will take it at your hands.

speaker: LADY CAPULET
text_entry: Enter CAPULET and Nurse

speaker: CAPULET
text_entry: When the sun sets, the air doth drizzle dew;

speaker: CAPULET
text_entry: But for the sunset of my brother's son

speaker: CAPULET
text_entry: It rains downright.

speaker: CAPULET
text_entry: How now! a conduit, girl? what, still in tears?

speaker: CAPULET
text_entry: Evermore showering? In one little body

speaker: CAPULET
text_entry: Thou counterfeit'st a bark, a sea, a wind;

speaker: CAPULET
text_entry: For still thy eyes, which I may call the sea,

speaker: CAPULET
text_entry: Do ebb and flow with tears; the bark thy body is,

speaker: CAPULET
text_entry: Sailing in this salt flood; the winds, thy sighs;

speaker: CAPULET
text_entry: Who, raging with thy tears, and they with them,

speaker: CAPULET
text_entry: Without a sudden calm, will overset

speaker: CAPULET
text_entry: Thy tempest-tossed body. How now, wife!

speaker: CAPULET
text_entry: Have you deliver'd to her our decree?

speaker: LADY CAPULET
text_entry: Ay, sir; but she will none, she gives you thanks.

speaker: LADY CAPULET
text_entry: I would the fool were married to her grave!

speaker: CAPULET
text_entry: Soft! take me with you, take me with you, wife.

speaker: CAPULET
text_entry: How! will she none? doth she not give us thanks?

speaker: CAPULET
text_entry: Is she not proud? doth she not count her blest,

speaker: CAPULET
text_entry: Unworthy as she is, that we have wrought

speaker: CAPULET
text_entry: So worthy a gentleman to be her bridegroom?

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: Not proud, you have; but thankful, that you have:

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: Proud can I never be of what I hate;

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: But thankful even for hate, that is meant love.

speaker: CAPULET
text_entry: How now, how now, chop-logic! What is this?

speaker: CAPULET
text_entry: 'Proud,' and 'I thank you,' and 'I thank you not;'

speaker: CAPULET
text_entry: And yet 'not proud,' mistress minion, you,

speaker: CAPULET
text_entry: Thank me no thankings, nor, proud me no prouds,

speaker: CAPULET
text_entry: But fettle your fine joints 'gainst Thursday next,

speaker: CAPULET
text_entry: To go with Paris to Saint Peter's Church,

speaker: CAPULET
text_entry: Or I will drag thee on a hurdle thither.

speaker: CAPULET
text_entry: Out, you green-sickness carrion! out, you baggage!

speaker: CAPULET
text_entry: You tallow-face!

speaker: LADY CAPULET
text_entry: Fie, fie! what, are you mad?

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: Good father, I beseech you on my knees,

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: Hear me with patience but to speak a word.

speaker: CAPULET
text_entry: Hang thee, young baggage! disobedient wretch!

speaker: CAPULET
text_entry: I tell thee what: get thee to church o' Thursday,

speaker: CAPULET
text_entry: Or never after look me in the face:

speaker: CAPULET
text_entry: Speak not, reply not, do not answer me;

speaker: CAPULET
text_entry: My fingers itch. Wife, we scarce thought us blest

speaker: CAPULET
text_entry: That God had lent us but this only child;

speaker: CAPULET
text_entry: But now I see this one is one too much,

speaker: CAPULET
text_entry: And that we have a curse in having her:

speaker: CAPULET
text_entry: Out on her, hilding!

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: God in heaven bless her!

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: You are to blame, my lord, to rate her so.

speaker: CAPULET
text_entry: And why, my lady wisdom? hold your tongue,

speaker: CAPULET
text_entry: Good prudence; smatter with your gossips, go.

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: I speak no treason.

speaker: CAPULET
text_entry: O, God ye god-den.

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: May not one speak?

speaker: CAPULET
text_entry: Peace, you mumbling fool!

speaker: CAPULET
text_entry: Utter your gravity o'er a gossip's bowl;

speaker: CAPULET
text_entry: For here we need it not.

speaker: LADY CAPULET
text_entry: You are too hot.

speaker: CAPULET
text_entry: God's bread! it makes me mad:

speaker: CAPULET
text_entry: Day, night, hour, tide, time, work, play,

speaker: CAPULET
text_entry: Alone, in company, still my care hath been

speaker: CAPULET
text_entry: To have her match'd: and having now provided

speaker: CAPULET
text_entry: A gentleman of noble parentage,

speaker: CAPULET
text_entry: Of fair demesnes, youthful, and nobly train'd,

speaker: CAPULET
text_entry: Stuff'd, as they say, with honourable parts,

speaker: CAPULET
text_entry: Proportion'd as one's thought would wish a man;

speaker: CAPULET
text_entry: And then to have a wretched puling fool,

speaker: CAPULET
text_entry: A whining mammet, in her fortune's tender,

speaker: CAPULET
text_entry: To answer 'I'll not wed; I cannot love,

speaker: CAPULET
text_entry: I am too young; I pray you, pardon me.'

speaker: CAPULET
text_entry: But, as you will not wed, I'll pardon you:

speaker: CAPULET
text_entry: Graze where you will you shall not house with me:

speaker: CAPULET
text_entry: Look to't, think on't, I do not use to jest.

speaker: CAPULET
text_entry: Thursday is near; lay hand on heart, advise:

speaker: CAPULET
text_entry: An you be mine, I'll give you to my friend;

speaker: CAPULET
text_entry: And you be not, hang, beg, starve, die in

speaker: CAPULET
text_entry: the streets,

speaker: CAPULET
text_entry: For, by my soul, I'll ne'er acknowledge thee,

speaker: CAPULET
text_entry: Nor what is mine shall never do thee good:

speaker: CAPULET
text_entry: Trust to't, bethink you; I'll not be forsworn.

speaker: CAPULET
text_entry: Exit

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: Is there no pity sitting in the clouds,

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: That sees into the bottom of my grief?

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: O, sweet my mother, cast me not away!

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: Delay this marriage for a month, a week;

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: Or, if you do not, make the bridal bed

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: In that dim monument where Tybalt lies.

speaker: LADY CAPULET
text_entry: Talk not to me, for I'll not speak a word:

speaker: LADY CAPULET
text_entry: Do as thou wilt, for I have done with thee.

speaker: LADY CAPULET
text_entry: Exit

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: O God!--O nurse, how shall this be prevented?

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: My husband is on earth, my faith in heaven;

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: How shall that faith return again to earth,

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: Unless that husband send it me from heaven

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: By leaving earth? comfort me, counsel me.

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: Alack, alack, that heaven should practise stratagems

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: Upon so soft a subject as myself!

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: What say'st thou? hast thou not a word of joy?

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: Some comfort, nurse.

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: Faith, here it is.

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: Romeo is banish'd; and all the world to nothing,

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: That he dares ne'er come back to challenge you;

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: Or, if he do, it needs must be by stealth.

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: Then, since the case so stands as now it doth,

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: I think it best you married with the county.

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: O, he's a lovely gentleman!

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: Romeo's a dishclout to him: an eagle, madam,

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: Hath not so green, so quick, so fair an eye

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: As Paris hath. Beshrew my very heart,

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: I think you are happy in this second match,

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: For it excels your first: or if it did not,

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: Your first is dead; or 'twere as good he were,

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: As living here and you no use of him.

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: Speakest thou from thy heart?

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: And from my soul too;

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: Or else beshrew them both.

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: Amen!

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: What?

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: Well, thou hast comforted me marvellous much.

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: Go in: and tell my lady I am gone,

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: Having displeased my father, to Laurence' cell,

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: To make confession and to be absolved.

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: Marry, I will; and this is wisely done.

speaker: Nurse
text_entry: Exit

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: Ancient damnation! O most wicked fiend!

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: Is it more sin to wish me thus forsworn,

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: Or to dispraise my lord with that same tongue

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: Which she hath praised him with above compare

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: So many thousand times? Go, counsellor;

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: Thou and my bosom henceforth shall be twain.

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: I'll to the friar, to know his remedy:

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: If all else fail, myself have power to die.

speaker: JULIET
text_entry: Exit
